intro: Herreria aculeata, commonly known as the prickly herreria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Herreria aculeata is known for its spiny foliage, which serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
